In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    str = ""
    for word in words
        if length(str) + length(word) > text_width
            println(str)
            str = ""
        end
        str *= "$word "
    end
    println(str)  # print the remaining string at the end
end

# Example:
s = "This is a test string for wrapping. It will wrap at the maximum width."
wrap_string(s, 15)
```

In this function, `split` is used to split the input string into an array of words. Then, we iterate over these words. If adding the current word to the current line would exceed the desired text width, we print the current line and start a new one. We then add the current word to the current line. After all words have been processed, we print the remaining part of the string.

The `wrap_string` function will wrap the input string at every `text_width` characters or words if the resulting strings are longer than `text_width`.
